intro: Lisianthius breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, clustered flowers are usually pink to lavender in color and bloom in late summer to early fall. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
